alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued January 30 at 11:08PM EST until January 31 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County. * WHEN...Until 10 PM EST Wednesday, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 3.5 feet, water covers roads on Saint George Island, is in yards, and is approaching structures. To the east, inundation is occurring at multiple marinas off St. Mary`s River, Smith Creek, and Jutland Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides two to two and a half feet above normal. The next high tide at Coltons Point is at 6:20 AM and 6:42 PM. The next high tide at Point Lookout is at 4:52 AM and 4:55 PM. The next high tide at Piney Point is at 5:44 AM. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. St Marys River at Straits Point MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 1.9 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 31/05 AM 3.5 1.9 2.3 0.5 Moderate 31/05 PM 3.5 1.9 2.4 0.5 Moderate 01/06 AM 3.4 1.8 2.1 0.5 Minor 01/06 PM 3.0 1.4 1.9 1.0 Minor 02/07 AM 2.9 1.3 1.6 0.5 None 02/07 PM 2.4 0.8 1.3 1.0 None &&
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
